result.name: attitudes-to-health-and-work-amongst-the-working-age-population-survey-2009-10
result.notes: Survey of 2,9659 working-age adults (16-64 year olds, undertaken November 2009 to March 2010 as part of the Office for National Statistics 'Opinions' Omnibus (individual level anonymised data). Covers attitudes to health and work.

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions

result.title: Attitudes to health and work amongst the working-age Population Survey 2009/10

extras.value: Not due to be released. Will be reviewed in the light of demand and prioritisation.
